                                                                         THE FORMATION LIGHTS ARE TYPICALLY OPERATED IN NORM MODE
                                                                         ONLY, AND THAT TO FLY FORMATION AT NIGHT, FORMATION STRIP
                                                                         LIGHTING (NORM) IS NOT REQUIRED BUT HIGHLY DESIRABLE.
                                                                         COVERT

                                                                         OPERATING WITH NVGS.
                                                                         - ANECDOTAL EVIDENCE FROM AIRCREW SUGGESTS THAT WHEN
                                                                         CARRYING OUT NVG FLYING OPERATIONS THE NVGS PROVIDE A
                                                                         LEVEL OF VISIBILITY SUCH THAT AIRCRAFT ARE VISIBLE
                                                                         WITHOUT FORMATION LIGHTS BEING ILLUMINATED. LIFLMO ARE
                                                                         SATISFIED THIS WILL HAVE NIL ENDANGERMENT TO FLIGHT

TAIL/SERIAL NO.        PART                                    MAINT ACTIVITY        DATE DUE  LIFE TYPE INT REM        TSS CODES
LCN,ALC                POSITION NAME       WAC                 TYPE LVL STD REC CLM  PREV DUE  INTERVAL
                                           LIFE SINCE NEW      INIT TYPE, INSTANCE             INIT LCN, ALC
                                                               ADMIN  CAPABILITY CODE
=====================  ======================================= =======================================================  ==========
                                                               (cont)    THESE ANCHOR NUTS WHICH HAVE A FLOATING THREADED INSERT
                                                                         INSIDE TO
                                                                         AID ALIGNMENT DURING BOLT INSTALLATION AND THESE ANCHOR
                                                                         NUTS ARE INSIDE THE WING FUEL TANK. IT APPEARS THAT DUE
                                                                         TO THE AWKWARD ACCESS, DURING PREVIOUS REMOVALS AND
                                                                         INSTALLATIONS OF THE ELBOW, THE BOLTS HAVE BEEN PUSHED
                                                                         DOWN TO AID IN
                                                                         REINSTALLATION, PRIMARILY TO HELP LOCATE AND START THE
                                                                         THREAD. THIS HAS DISLODGED THE THREADED INSERTS INSIDE
                                                                         THE ANCHOR NUTS, CAUSING THEM TO DROP DOWN.  THE
                                                                         RETAINING TABS THAT STOP THE THREADED INSERT FROM
                                                                         SPINNING INSIDE THE ANCHOR NUT HOUSING MAY BE DAMAGED.
                                                                         FULL REPAIR OF THE AREA WOULD REQUIRE THE WING TO BE
                                                                         REMOVED FROM THE AIRCRAFT. IN CONSULTATION WITH LIFLMO WE
                                                                         HAVE BEEN ABLE
                                                                         TO RE LOCATE THE FLOATING NUTS ENOUGH TO THE UPPER
                                                                         PORTION OF THE ANCHOR NUT BODY TO ALLOW THE MOUNTING
                                                                         BOLTS TO ENGAGE THE THREAD. REPAIR OF THE AREA HAS BEEN
                                                                         CARRIED OUT IAW VH101B-44A27-6A2 CAP CHAPTER 41-10 (FUEL
                                                                         TANK LEAK REPAIR). THE VENT PIPE IS WET ASSEMBLED USING
                                                                         PR1422 AS WELL AS THE AREA BEING OVER COATED WITH SEALANT
                                                                         TO REPAIR THE FUEL LEAK. WITH THE FLOATING NUT SEMI
                                                                         RETAINED THE MOUNTING BOLTS WERE CORRECTLY FITTED IAW
                                                                         VH101B-44A27-1C CAP MP 16-10/2
                                                                         AND APPLY THE CORRECT TORQUE VALUE. HOWEVER THERE ARE
                                                                         STILL ISSUES WITH CORRECT FLOATING NUT RETENTION WHEN
                                                                         MOUNTING BOLTS ARE NOT INSTALLED. THE INSIDE OF
                                                                         THE TANK HAS BEEN INSPECTED AND HAVE INSURED THERE IS NO
                                                                         DAMAGE TO THE ANCHOR
                                                                         NUT BODY AND ALSO CORRECT ASSEMBLY. LIFLMO ADVICE AND
                                                                         SUPPORT PROVIDED FOR THIS DEFERMENT OF MAINTENANCE REFER
                                                                         TO DEFERED DEFECT NO. DD001 REF FILENET 004012116 DEFERED
                                                                         DEFECT REGISTER: FILENET 004012116 VERSION 4
                                                                         RESIDUAL MISSION/CAPABILITY RISK ASSESSMENT: VERY LOW
                                                                         LIMITATIONS: NIL.

                                                                         VERY MINOR AND IS ASSESSED AS HAVING NO AFFECT ON FLIGHT
                                                                         SAFETY FOR THE
                                                                         PERIOD OF DEFERMENT. THE 2 CRACKS REFER BAEPEANDT 107-22
                                                                         SHOWS THAT THE LH SHROUD CRACK IS CURRENTLY 2MM IN LENGTH
                                                                         EMINATING FROM A RIVET HEAD HOLE. THE RH
                                                                         SHROUD CRACK IS CURRENTLY 3MM IN LENGTH EMINATING FROM A
                                                                         RIVET HEAD HOLE.  AT
                                                                         BOTH CRACK LOCATIONS THE INSTALLED RIVETS ARE ASSESSED AS
                                                                         SERVICEABLE STILL MAINTAINING DESIGN FUNCTION. THE AREA
                                                                         IS INSPECTED AT EVERY FLIGHT SERVICING AND ANY FURTHER
                                                                         DEGREDATION OR CRACK GROWTH WILL BE IDENTIFIED. THE 2
                                                                         CRACKS IDENTIFED ARE ASSESSED AS HAVING NO IMPACT TO
                                                                         FLIGHT SAFETY.
                                                                         LIMITATIONS: NIL.
                                                                         ADDITIONAL COMMENTS/SMR REQUIREMENTS:
                                                                         LCN / FLCN: A/00
                                                                         POD: R40
                                                                         AUTH: J. DYKSTRA

                                                                         ENDANGER FLIGHT SAFETY ASSSSMENT: NO CREDIBLE FLIGHT

                                                                         LIGHT IR COMPONENT TESTIND IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE
                                                                         PERFORMED.
                                                                         - AIRCREW ADVICE (REFERENCE A) PROVIDES CONFIRMATION THAT
                                                                         THE FORMATION LIGHTS ARE TYPICALLY OPERATED IN NORM MODE
                                                                         ONLY, AND THAT TO FLY FORMATION LIGHT AT NIGHT, FORMATION
                                                                         STRIP LIGHTING (NORM) IS NOT REQUIRED BUT HIGHLY
                                                                         DESIRABLE. COVERT (COV) MODE IS CONSIDERED A NICE TO HAVE
                                                                         WHEN OPERATING WITH NVGS.
                                                                         - ANECDOTAL EVIDENCE FROM AIRCREW SUGGESTS THAT WHEN
                                                                         CARRYING OUT NVG FLYING OPERATIONS THE NVGS PROVIDE A
                                                                         LEVEL OF VISIBILITY SUCH THAT AIRCRAFT ARE VISIBLE
                                                                         WITHOUT FORMATION LIGHTS BEING ILLUMINATED. LIFLMO ARE
                                                                         SATISFIED THIS WILL HAVE NIL ENDAGEMENT TO FLIGHT SAFETY.

                                                                         COMPONENT OF TESTING IS NOT REQUIRED TO BE PERFORMED.
                                                                         - AIRCREW ADVICE (REFERENCE A) PROVIDES CONFIRMATION THAT
                                                                         THE FORMATION LIGHTS ARE TYPICALLY OPERATED IN NORM MODE
                                                                         ONLY, AND THAT TO FLY FORMATION AT NIGHT, FORMATION STRIP
                                                                         LIGHTING (NORM) IS NOT REQUIRED BUT HIGHLY DESIRABLE.
                                                                         COVERT
                                                                         (COV) MODE IS ONLY CONSIDERED A NICE TO HAVE WHEN
                                                                         OPERATING WITH NVGS.
                                                                         - ANECDOTAL EVIDENCE FROM AIRCREW SUGGESTS THAT WHEN
                                                                         CARRYING OUT NVG FLYING OPERATIONS THE NVGS PROVIDE A
                                                                         LEVEL OF VISIBILITY SUCH THAT AIRCRAFT ARE VISIBLE
                                                                         WITHOUT FORMATION LIGHTS BEING ILLUMINATED. LIFLMO ARE
                                                                         SATISFIED THIS WILL HAVE NIL ENDANGERMENT TO FLIGHT
                                                                         SAFETY
